intro: [WRONG START] Piper politum var. pallidibracteatum, commonly known as the pale bract pepper vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It features heart-shaped, glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by small, round berries that turn red when mature. Its stems are slender and woody, often twining around supports as it grows. It is valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
